intro: Calandrinia dipetala, commonly known as the two-petaled portulaca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and they bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calandrinia dipetala is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its beauty and drought tolerance.
